entities.name: FATIGUE
entities.description: A factor that has been linked to an increased likelihood of experiencing deja vu. Fatigue can impact cognitive processes and may contribute to the phenomenon.|

entities.name: experience
entities.description: A subjective and often fleeting experience of familiarity with a current situation.

entities.name: SCIENTISTS
entities.description: Experts in various fields who have studied and attempted to explain the phenomenon of deja vu. They have proposed several theories and conducted research to understand the underlying mechanisms of this mysterious experience.|

entities.name: brain
entities.description: The brain is the central organ of the nervous system and plays a crucial role in processing information, storing memories, and regulating various bodily functions.

attributes.Function: Processing Information, Storing Memories, Regulating Bodily Functions

entities.name: remains
entities.description: A mysterious and puzzling experience that defies easy explanation.

entities.name: researchers and general public
entities.description: The group comprising individuals involved in academic research and the broader population outside academia.

entities.name: complexities
entities.description: The intricate and often inexplicable aspects of human experience that are difficult to quantify or fully understand.

entities.name: delve
entities.description: To investigate deeply and extensively

entities.name: explanation
entities.description: A puzzling and elusive concept that cannot be easily explained.

entities.name: factors
entities.description: Variables that influence the occurrence of deja vu

entities.name: Two Separate Areas
entities.description: The brain processes information in two separate areas for storage and retrieval, which is a key aspect of the dual processing theory.

entities.name: elusive
entities.description: Deja vu is an inexplicable and mysterious experience.

entities.name: DUAL PROCESSING THEORY
entities.description: A theory suggesting that deja vu occurs when the brain processes information in two different ways simultaneously, leading to a delay or discrepancy in the timing of these processes, which creates the sensation of having experienced the current situation before.|

entities.name: defies
entities.description: Deifies means that deja vu cannot be easily explained.

entities.name: theories
entities.description: Theories are proposed interpretations or hypotheses that attempt to explain phenomena.

entities.name: proposed
entities.description: Proposed explanations or hypotheses.

entities.name: phenomenon
entities.description: A phenomenon that captivates interest but remains largely unexplained.

entities.name: human
entities.description: Biological and cognitive organisms characterized by high intelligence and self-awareness.

entities.name: conclusion
entities.description: A concise statement encapsulating the main points of an argument, discussion, or report.

entities.name: underlying mechanisms
entities.description: The fundamental processes that explain how deja vu occurs.

entities.name: curious
entities.description: A mysterious and unexpected sensory event

entities.name: science
entities.description: Science is a systematic and logical approach to discovering how the world works.

entities.name: light
entities.description: The experience of remembering an event that one is currently experiencing.

entities.name: continue
entities.description: The ongoing exploration and study by researchers.

entities.name: DEJA VU
entities.description: A phenomenon where individuals feel they have experienced a current situation before, despite it being the first time it is happening. It is a mysterious and largely unexplained occurrence that has intrigued scientists, psychologists, and the general public for centuries. Theories about its cause include dual processing and memory-based explanations, and factors like stress, fatigue, and creativity can increase its frequency. Despite extensive research, the phenomenon remains elusive and difficult to study in a controlled environment.|

entities.name: various
entities.description: Proposed explanations and factors.

entities.name: Individuals with Higher Creativity or Imagination
entities.description: Individuals who have a higher level of creativity or imagination may be more prone to experiencing deja vu.

entities.name: secrets
entities.description: The mysteries refer to the unknown aspects of consciousness and the human brain that scientists are trying to understand.

entities.name: laboratory setting
entities.description: A structured space for conducting scientific experiments and studies.

entities.name: subjective experience
entities.description: A personal and individual interpretation of sensory input.

entities.name: MEMORY-BASED THEORY
entities.description: A theory positing that deja vu is triggered by similarities between the current situation and a past memory. When the brain encounters a situation that is reminiscent of a past experience, it may mistakenly interpret it as a memory, leading to the sensation of deja vu.|

entities.name: General Public
entities.description: The general population who are interested in and fascinated by the phenomenon of deja vu.

entities.name: creativity
entities.description: The ability to generate new and unique ideas.

entities.name: puzzling
entities.description: Deja vu is an inexplicable experience characterized by the feeling of familiarity with events that are happening for the first time.

entities.name: PSYCHOLOGISTS
entities.description: Experts in the field of psychology who have contributed to the understanding of deja vu by exploring its psychological and cognitive aspects. They have proposed theories and conducted studies to explain the phenomenon.|

entities.name: FRENCH
entities.description: French is a Romance language primarily spoken in France and many other countries around the world.

entities.name: imagination
entities.description: Imagination refers to the cognitive process of forming new ideas and images in one's mind, often beyond direct sensory input.

entities.name: enigmatic
entities.description: Characterized by hidden meanings or complex symbols that are not easily understood.

entities.name: nature
entities.description: The subjective and elusive experience of deja vu.

entities.name: Cognitive Processes
entities.description: Cognitive processes are mental operations that include perception, attention, memory, language, problem-solving, and decision-making.

entities.name: measured and quantified
entities.description: Information expressed in measurable terms.
